intro: Acourtia elizabethiae, commonly known as Elizabeth's acourtia, is a rare flowering plant native to the United States, specifically found in California. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in coastal scrub habitats. It is notable for its limited distribution and is considered endangered due to habitat loss and environmental changes. Acourtia elizabethiae plays an important ecological role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its native range.
